Building MCP Servers

This guide walks you through creating your first MCP server. By the end, you'll understand the core concepts and be ready to build production-ready integrations.

Prerequisites

Before starting, make sure you have:

  • Python 3.10+ or Node.js 18+ installed
  • Basic understanding of JSON Schema
  • Familiarity with async programming (see our async primer)

Installation

Install the MCP SDK using your preferred package manager: 

pip install mcp-sdk

For TypeScript users, see the npm package.

Your First Server

Create a new file and add the following code. This creates a simple server that exposes a calculator tool: 

from mcp import Server, Tool

server = Server("calculator")

@server.tool()
async def add(a: int, b: int) -> int:
    """Add two numbers together."""
    return a + b

if __name__ == "__main__":
    server.run()

Testing Your Server

Use the MCP Inspector to test your server interactively. For automated testing, see testing best practices.

Next Steps

Now that you have a basic server running:

  • Learn about resources for exposing data
  • Add prompts for guided interactions
  • Explore example servers on GitHub
